citation.article-title: Adhaeribacter aerophilus sp. nov., Adhaeribacter aerolatus sp. nov. and Segetibacter aerophilus sp. nov., isolated from air samples
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Adhaeribacter aerolatus sp. nov.
Adhaeribacter aerolatus (ae.ro.la′tus. Gr. n. aer air; L. part. adj. latus carried; N.L. masc. part. adj. aerolatus airborne).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-stain-negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods that are 1.0–1.2 μm in diameter and 1.8–2.8 μm in length.
Colonies are smooth, circular, convex and pink after 3 days at 30 °C on R2A agar.
Grows on NA and WA (very weakly) but not on LB, TSA and MacConkey agar.
Growth occurs at 10–35 °C, at pH 6.5–9.0 and with 0–1.5 % NaCl.
Does not hydrolyse casein, chitin, hypoxanthine, tyrosine or xanthine.

Positive (in API 20NE and API ZYM strips) for hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase, and negative for nitrate reduction, indole production, acid production from glucose, arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-galactosidase (substrate p-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and α-fucosidase.
Does not assimilate any of the carbohydrates tested (API 20NE and API ID 32GN).

Positive for assimilation of the following substrates: amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, inulin, lactate, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, N-acetylglucosamine, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose.

Negative for assimilation of the following substrates: acetate, adipate, d-adonitol, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, citrate, dextran, dulcitol, erythritol, formate, d-fucose, l-fucose, gluconate, l-glutamic acid, glutaric acid, glycerol, glycogen, histidine, inositol, itaconate, d-lyxose, malate, maleic acid, malonate, d-mannitol, oxalic acid, phenylacetate, l-proline, propionate, pyruvic acid, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, succinic acid, d-tagatose, tartaric acid, xylitol and l-xylose.
The predominant isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The major fatty acids are summed feature 4 (comprising iso-C17 : 1 I and/or anteiso-C17 : 1 B), C16 : 1ω5c and iso-C15 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 43.9 mol%.
The type strain, 6515J-31T (=KACC 14117T =NBRC 106133T), was isolated from an air sample from Jeju, Republic of Korea.
